reviewText: a nice little story the rhythm of the verse is good for children for many reasons the story told lacks tension i suspect it would not hold a child s attention even for the length of this one perhaps adding a bit about the girl looking for a toy perfect for her in the same shop

i m sorry but this story is too drawn out and lackluster i finally tossed it nothing was happening author took too many words to say too little her female is not believable having had a crush on this guy forever and it s like nothing of interest has happened in her life all these years just couldn t handle it reminded me of some of those really baaadd hallmark movies

halfway thru the book the humans decide to ambush the aliens kill them all and nuke any trace of their existence when done the humans jump in their ford to drive off and live happily ever after good pre teen writing

women serial killer of the th century is a detailed book about sick minded women killing their kin and relatives during the th century the book shows a thorough study of women all over the world using arcenic poisening in my opinion this book is more a listing of sevaral cases of historic poiseners and not really a book that one could read from beginning to end in one sitting from a historic point of view though this is definetely worth having on your digital shelf for looking up facts you could need in study or otherwise
disappointed too short do not like the end of this sequel will not read any more good as far as it went

you get what you pay for way too short funny but in a very negative way everyone knows that the facade is happy wonderful and perfect and that there is a lot going on behind the scenes that is far from these adjectives but it was not very factual with a lot of vague references to when and where i was just disappointed
shea tre stuck together by working together dealing with the ex out maneuvered him got out of dodge yazoo

all this book was after the soulmates met was sex that s fine but it left you with a sense that they should at least get to know each other better i was really annoyed reading this book i was even more let down by how the situation with the so called vest friend worked out

i have read a little more than half of the book and have come to the conclusion that i cannot suspend my disbelief enough to enjoy this story what follows contains spoilers so proceed with caution for those who do not want to read said spoilers i will get right to my conclusion an interesting premise ruined by poor plot and character development the book starts off with a surprise attack on sydney tehran and beijing by aliens whose only attempt at communication is the enigmatic message never again attempt to develop this kind of technology apparently referring to advanced research being carried out in those three cities what follows is humanity uniting to build a space fleet capable of defending themselves from further attack and to find out just who their attackers are initially three are built one each built by china iran and the eu so far so good it is what happens once these ships are built that is not so good by an extremely unlikely set of circumstances all chinese naval officers senior to the protagonist with the required qualifications to command the chinese ship were at a required training session in beijing during the attack and were all killed the protagonist is a young attractive female lieutenant of the chinese navy apparently her sole qualification is her familiarity with the advanced technology in question acquired during a whole two hours on site as a liaison to the project this it seems is sufficient for the chinese government to place her in command of china s first starship and a full third of the world s entire space fleet instead of rising to the occasion she proceeds to behave like an emotionally immature teenage girl first she makes a headlong attack on an alien ship without making any attempt to determine its identity capabilities or intentions when she is challenged on this by her xo she reacts by ignoring him and proceeding with the attack she is victorious and captures a prisoner an alien fighter pilot determined to be of the race that attacked earth instead of treating the alien like a prisoner of war she befriends it and gives it the run of the ship this is where i stopped reading at this point i would expect a board of inquiry followed by a courts martial to determine the protagonist s punishment never mind remaining in command but i doubt that level of logic will be a part of this story

i was really looking forward to skyler and wade s story but i was sorely disappointed i find myself needing more more depth of the story a longer time line just more of everything it would ve been better not to have read and just imagined the story save your and pass this one

logic problems in how the characters progressd she has to be this totally awesome confident woman to even tempt this jaded playboy like way over the top she s not her genuineness doesn t make it known until thru his character is so anti monogamy there is no hope for a hea then she goes all wishy washy even with all the money in the world this wasn t believable and as a uber rich guy he wasn t that likeable until the end
okay so i was wanting a tasteful excuse the pun story what this story is beyond i mean in my opinion just filth is there a negative rating

interesting if you like reading about what other people do i was hoping to find little tidbits of guidance and or instruction to help me along with my own wip sadly disappointed but the bright side was the price didn t empty my wallet

honestly this woman is so dumb she put her baby herself in danger just because she is nosy this author should go back to writing children s books mick should hire a full time baby sitter for his stupid wife

diana h myers i had read amish lillies by the lakeside i gave it four stars because it lacked details important to the storyline other than that i liked the book i thought this might be better wrong this book also had details left out in the first book it read like a book it was hard to read because it skipped around from present to past too much as far as storyline book was the only interesting one yet i didn t like the characters and their dialogue didn t seem realistic to the amish culture an author should know that spell check does not edit if someone would have proof read the book they would have caught countless errors in all honesty i can t recommend this book

i tried to read this but half way through it i couldnt do it anymore i mean the h and h just at each other all the time and it was getting on my nerves i mean they liked each other but just couldnt get pass crap i mean where was the romance i didnt even finish it
hot and heavy reading but shallow because of the intent of the subject matter this is erotic material after all

another high quality darkfuse title i must start off by saying that i think that gary fry is a very good writer and as appreciation of any story is subjective no one can expect to connect with everything every writer writes this one just was sort of meh for me high points for creepiness and good writing i thought the changes that were tormenting the main character were quite well done the points off are contained in the spoilers however spoiler alert lt spoiler it must be said that fry is treading very familiar ground with a story of this type pregnant woman feels that something is wrong even sinister with her soon to be born child so comparisons are to be expected this one to make it stand out required a heavier touch than i am used to from fry who is more subtle and traditional see his wonderful novella emergence or even lurker which is darker but still very traditional in style ira levin wrote the definitive story of this type a long time ago and as a recent example tim curran s sow also from darkfuse is similar conceptually but goes for the throat from the outset and leaves you shaking and disturbed lt end spoiler
when guys like tex have nowhere else to go they always seem to find the path to some god what a mess
not a badly written book but it never really hooked me i stuck with it because of the writing but the characters and story line presented no real surprises and the hea was predictable

this book was reasonably well written the characters were believable and well developed the plot however was more like an episode of the twilight zone and groundhog day combined not necessarily a good combination
this book is a repetition of the second book in the series until at least to of the novel its disgraceful no matter how cheap it is the the editor accepted it

as a cornish woman myself now living in the usa i know exactly what cadbury s dairy milk golden syrup lemon curd clotted cream and granulated and caster sugars are but for an american reading this there is going to be some frustration not only are most of the above ingredients hard to find if you do find them over here they are very expensive i have a scale that can be used in both metric and imperial but i realize that once again most americans do not use scales when baking that was one thing that amazed me when we moved over here however saying all that if you go online you can google the measurements and once you have converted the main ones it will be easy to convert the rest ml of double cream is cups so just a little over cups i don t think it is going to affect the recipe if you are not exactly accurate with your measuring g condensed milk is just over ounces which is just under a cup yet again a little over or under is not going to affect the recipe that much there is a good lot of british humor in this book and this woman is a woman after my own heart as she suggests strongly using only real vanilla yee haa only the best so even if you never make these ice creams get the book and be ready to start drooling the recipes are delicious were i writing this review for the english market i would have given it stars but as this has been released over here for the american market i feel that i can only fairly give it stars as for more folks to be able to enjoy it it needs to be converted into imperial us measurements and yes there is a difference in a us gallon pint and a gallon pint elsewhere in the world a us gallon only has fl ozs whereas elsewhere a pint has fl ozs

i really don t know what to say regarding this book i m an avid reader of all types of books but this book just left me with so many questions there were several different story lines that were never really finished this book jumps from character to character without really allowing you to get into the mind of the characters i hope this author takes this criticism and applies it to all future books she may want to write
thrilling but i had not realised that the book was only part of the saga so disappointed about that i thought that the characters were very believable and set in believable surroundings
this book was free not as funny as her other book s i felt sorry for simone and did not like the billionaire he played to many head games

i started off thinking this is an apocalyptic sci fi book then there s a goddess thrown in which kind of threw the whole story into another direction for me and not in a good way i could maybe come to terms with the goddess but the male fairies with erections on her shoulders holding her dress up not so much without them i d probably rate this book higher

loved the characters but the story is really leaving us up in the air if you went through the first installment you will probably enjoy this one as well but as the story continues the plot gets a lot like lost be forwarned also many people loved this series so i am maybe the odd one out

this is a classic military naval sf novel much in the style of campbell s lost fleet series or perhaps even more so the new battlestar galactica series however it does not reach the level of either of these an old fashioned space carrier becomes the only defense against hostile unknown aliens it is mildly entertaining with battles and a number fo characters with their own problems and abilities unfortunately it feels like an ok copy of the previously mentioned excellent series i won t read the second installment

this book was just alright i wish that the female lead had more of a back bone that is very annoying i have read other books by this author and enjoyed this loved blind faith but this one just didn t do it for me with that being said i will continue to read this authors books
the characters are definitely over the top but despite poor editing and the need to accept that women could have been so liberated in those days the book is readable and i continued to turn the pages

i always find myself buying her books i like the length and the cost i feel comfortable in her using the conflict about mating in each of her stories but i m so tired of the over use of all the snark and shrewishness it gets old the girls constantly snip at each other they are mean and smart alecks to their mates in every book the females take pride in smashing their heels into the males feet they especially love to take groin shots that really makes them gleeful there truly isn t anything to like about them the relationships have no kindness no friendliness no tenderness on the girls parts why would anyone want to even know them at one point one male in anger asks what did he do to deserve the misfortune of her as his mate and it hurts her feelings really i m sorry but there isn t any kind of true relationship between the mates except a physical one until the very last minutes it s all sex and fighting i would like to see the author try a slightly different formula soon where there will be some love and romance in the book anger and sarcasm and slap stick violence can only entertain for so long if everyone in the cast is unreasonable they just seem like idiots
not sure why i got this book anymore but i did read it by the end i truly wondered why i bothered

don t get me wrong i expect to have to suspend belief to some extent when reading this genre but in this book the characters seem to change their mind at the drop of a hat it just didn t come together for me
good story but too much detailed sex why is it necessary to describe all the actions i would not recommend this book if you are like me and don t want the sex

a very short story for the faithful i m not the priest in the story is not only miss average who wasn t sure of herself is a true believer this story tries to be the exorcist but with not enough storyline it just doesn t work

contact by laurisa white reyes is a coming of age story about a teenage girl who after her sixteenth birthday develops a rather unusual gift erhm curse mira ortiz can know your entire life story your dreams your nightmares every memory with just one touch she believes it s a curse until her mother falls into a coma and mira believes that the cause is more than her mother s diabetes so this book fell flat for me don t get me wrong the characters the plot even the tiniest bit of suspense were good but just not for me let me start with the characters mira ortiz is a young girl who can now read every though that a person has ever had with just one touch it s her curse i know personally that i would be just a little freaked out but mira isn t just freaked no she s depressed she wants a way out so the book begins with her in the hospital after a failed suicide attempt um excuse me but i lost interest there call me heartless but suicide seems like a cheater s way out of a bad situation so already i had doubts about the main character going in then there s david who is kinda sorta the love interest he s cute but has a secret one that makes me dislike him again call me heartless but sorry can t reveal his secret without spoilers then there s the plot my thoughts are the main plot is why mira can all of a sudden read everyone s thoughts with just a touch but alas that is not the case in fact mira becomes obsessed with her father s lack of emotion when her mother slips into insulin shock coma she becomes so obsessed she believes that her father is trying to kill her mother mira goes back and forth between believing her father is a good guy to believing he s the enemy very wishy washy also i was yelling at mira through my kindle telling her she had it all wrong i had guessed long before the end who the bad guy was now i may have guessed the villain but i did not guess all the details of the ending the plot and subplot were extensive and tied together neatly in the end overall i would give this book stars not quite a star read for me but better than most stars if you like suspense and sci fi mixed into a coming of age story than i believe you will enjoy this book i received a copy of this book from the publisher via netgalley in exchange for an honest review

i read all the jane yellowrock books in the main series but for some reason i could not keep interest here i haven t finished it and i probably never will but generally i am not a fan of these short novella stories as most of the time i find them unnecessary
i m waiting for the girls to ruin this like the briarcreek series and you could tell that it is about to happen

historical novels with strong female leading characters are compelling to me so i thought i d give this one a chance the book started out well a woman with a mystery in her past makes friends in a new town starts a business and begins to have feelings for one of her employees then things went downhill i don t care for graphic sex scenes in the novels i read and there were several here but i could have forgiven them if they had been congruent with the characters however the scenes in this book were not major spoiler alert when a character has endured rape and then her first encounter with her former fianc eacute is incredibly rough sex followed by him storming off this is not only out of character but is downright abusive and sickening especially if she still moons about him and wonders if he will ever love her sick i started the book with a great sense of expectation and finished it with nausea and loathing skip this one unless the above scenario appeals to you
super short and corny did not like it just my opinion i felt like it did have potential maybe as a full novel it would have been better
lots of good ideas that can be adapted to home cooking as well i liked the biscuit ideas i think that i would cook them in a caste iron pan instead of on a stick

this author is a dog lover she puts herself in the mind of a dog and creates cute humorous stories that are a joy to read if you ve ever owned a dog you ll be able to relate to these tails ms chevrestt has used her own dogs for inspiration to inject realism into her story even the fantasy story has a ring of truth you don t have to love dogs to read these stories because you ll find yourself being charmed by her pet characters anyway one of my favorite touches is how the author points out dogs think we have god wrong it should be dog they consider that the almighty being thank you the first story is my favorite the dog s lady owner wishes she could trade places with her dog and not have to deal with her human life and all the work associated with it be careful what you wish for the author s descriptions are right on and how she envisions the human acting in the dog s body is hilarious the dog s reaction is great too oh my dog the author gives you a body exchange story a canine cookie robbery and a life lesson for the pampered dog another story or two might have rounded it out a bit more but the stories within are gems her stories show the differences in breed personalities the gave me a smile as i followed along in the story don t be surpriesd if you laugh out loud in a couple of spots they re short and sweet and easy to read quickly if you re having a down day this book will pick up your spirits originally posted at las sci fi fantasy reviews

this story has so much potential but it is too short now i realize that it is a novella however with stories like this one it needs to be novel length i liked the characters loved the plot and enjoyed the backstory i would love to see this story written as a novel
definitely try out a sample before buying though because i m not sure i would say it is worth ten bucks

i m bilingual spanish english and with latin roots which identify me somehow with the main characters however for the same reason made don t like they way they were presented it was very difficult to associate kiki with an argentinian culture when every time she talked in spanish she sounded more like a mexican or somebody from central america caribean anyway otherwise kiki and mark relationship was cute with lots of funny situations

the pros and cons of rune pros good story concept quick read i finished it in less than an hour cons the writing is utterly simplistic and if it weren t for the constant use of offensive language it could ve been a great read for ten year olds the dialogue is awkward and feels forced overall rune doesn t offer anything new you haven t read before i ve enjoyed this author s adult horror novels but struggled to get into this story and connect with the underdeveloped characters not a read i ll recommend to my closest friends but if you re in the mood for an effortless quick read before bedtime this would definitely be it check out jh glaze s john hazzard novels and his other novellas which in my opinion are way better than this

the price and story idea was why i chose this book i thought it would be a nice change of pace where the man wanted his wife back after she left him and now here she was calling him for help the story at times left me confused and thinking why is this conversation happening and then at other time i felt the author showed the love between the two even when they could not see it

i am not sure where the other reviews came from for this title but do not believe them i went into earthwalker with certain expectations i read the reviews i liked the mini preview on the amazon page but this story is not what i expected it is awful quite frankly i am a little miffed that i spent cents on it before those who wrote reviews and loved it go crazy i will tell you why i dislike it so first the character of decklan while props for the cool name is awful not in the omg she is a raving loon but in the sense that i felt no compassion for her or her so called plight decklan is everything one would expect a female police officer to be tough smart and able to handle herself so why did i not like her simple in the midst of all her so called character traits listed above she is whinny i mean come on you have bad luck with men join the rest of us oh your mommy died again that is part of life and my daddy is mia and has a new family yikes i mean for all the time the auhtor spends telling the reader that decklan is tough and attractive and all that she spent little time actually showing us that she is all these things the climax happens and there is a glimpse but not enough to save the annoyance that is decklan holmes second the male characters and the story line are too predictable so much so that i pretty much knew what was going on early on the fact that decklan is a detective and she has no clue gives merit to what i was saying about the characterization of decklan by the author there is the typical bad boy and good boy and the pull towards the bad boy that decklan cannot seem to get past the minor characters are suppose to be influencial but i found them fillers used to patch up holes in the storyline third the storyline ug where to begin i am all in favor of fresh mythology revloving around parnormal and fantasy but if one is going to mix the generes they must think okay does this make sense the mythology here is frustrating and quite frankly bad i understood what the author wanted to do i just think too much of something is usually not the way to go this story jumps around angels demons and realms fearies and everywhere in between i found it confusing and uneccessary the story would have improved greatly had the author stuck to one thing make them all angels or demons hell even mermaids but do not hop from one to the next it does not make it better but makes it annoying overall i will not be back should anymore in this series be made i found i detested decklan and her behavior as well as the mythology surrounding her special ness i did not like the so called romance between the characters and thought a certain things a little strange branding rings rain really on a last note i take offense to the author s use of the nickname sherlock and watson i am quite sure that if sir doyle knew this he would be infuriated

steve does a good job of making a well written case for the prophetic event of the rapture being only a myth however steve makes several critical errors he only uses a few of the verses that support the rapture and second he neglects all of the context that supports the rapture event there are some very easy to understand events that could only happen if christians were raptured first read with caution

how i wish that many youth in our society today would ready novels like this the coming of true love in its most real sense is something that is often overlooked too often we enter into a love relationship even a marriage thinking that if it does not work we can always end it legally and go on to something else waiting is not something that we do well this author presents the reader with an example of young people today who practice that patience they wait for the one that is right for them and only that one despite other offers and hardships there is a real parallel to the biblical story of rachel read it and see what patience can bring
i liked this book and i guess i am waiting for the second installment to fully enjoy this good its a good read
this was a fun light read and i was able to finish the book in days my only problem was that the book was factually inaccurate and full of grammar issues and typos this made the book hard to read

my issue with this book besides the unnecessary dragging of the plot line is the believability factor it slipped into oblivion i love street fiction and i definitely support g street chronicles as a highly lauded player in the publishing game having said that there are quite a few books in their catalogue that have great stories but are wholly unrealistic i know good fiction reading is what i do for recreation any good street fiction has to keep it authentic so many events that took place in this book made no sense you can t expect readers to believe that this group of strong street wise women would invite a random chick into their circle they not only immediately accepted jareka but handed her an all access pass i won t go on but i expect better from gsh
i guess i expected something more not sure probably will not read the rest

i truly believe this book was written by an extremely ocd person hoping to trick people by using the words speed cleaning tho person talks about cleaning kid s bedrooms for days how not using zip ties causes them to spend hours sorting the wires in their living room the author probably cries when a family member puts groceries away and put an item in it s wrong alphabetical location at least some of the natural cleaning recipes were good an some tips were good but do not expect this book to help you save time cleaning the author literally says you need to think like a maid when you clean and face it maids spend all day every day cleaning because they get paid for it honestly for good cleaning tips that actually help you keep things clean and organized and save time i ll stick with flylady

great story idea this is not a rehash of run of the mill subject matter i found it hard to put down my only negative is the grammar syntax spelling and left out words it sometimes feels as though english is a second language for this author but don t let that stop you from reading this story i look forward to future books
i was really enjoying this beautiful story then it suddenly became a story of lust and passion not quite where i thought it was headed originally i was terribly disappointed
i was getting a little antsy focusing on the sparkles until the last page finally spoke to what matters most
it s an interesting idea but i couldn t get into it the characters lacked a lot of depth for me i never felt like the conversations were organic they always felt strained and unrealistic
what a sweet little story great depth of character and a fun read i recommend this book and will look for more by this author

there are alot of characters character analysis gossip messy lives and bad language but very little plot the end was abrupt and had an unsatisfying cliffhanger started good but fizzled out became boring how many drunken tirades can you have in one book

i am struggling to rate a small novella of only pages and it s even more difficult because absolutely nothing happens in part one except for their arrival to the dining club i do know that i am not impressed with these characters so far i don t find david to be an appealing or even likeable character he has a thing for biting and forcing pleasure through pain not really a fan of that just fyi in case anyone else is curious about the content i am also not into the sharing thing and it sounds like there may be some sharing going on later in the book this is the first of a series of novellas and for the life of me i don t understand why we can t just get the whole book instead of waiting for eight novellas to be published the first one has not really peeked my curiosity enough to continue my advice wait till they are all published and more than likely it can be a whole book at once instead of having to read it in pieces i also noticed that each of these novellas past part one are each do the math before you start this series

i was surprised that this short story turned out to be a loose take on cinderella it works out great though because it imaginatively intertwined the fairy tale with science fiction and the world of the doctor i enjoyed seeing how the author integrated the two that element of fairy tale magic was immediately and correctly dismissed by the doctor but unfortunately there was no explanation given for the science behind reanimating dead people and for the ending with princess ash it all seems very like magic and i m surprised that the doctor didn t discover what was the mechanism behind it this was the reason why i lowered the rating for this story because i really enjoyed it but i was left feeling very confused at the end in addition to fairy tales this story also incorporates a version of zombies which i thought was pretty interesting it s horrific and well described so i think that grounded this story in a good old fashioned who adventure as the doctor tries to understand and help the people in this world the other main characters were brief and mostly fulfilled predictable and stereotypical roles but it worked to keep the plot going and i felt interested enough in the characters to hope they succeeded the th doctor is captured well in this in all his charming and slightly eccentric ways and there are even a couple really funny moments in this story although it is all too brief this is a very enjoyable read that i would probably recommend even more strongly if only there were more of an explanation about how certain things happened in the plot i received this book from the publisher or author for a fair and honest review i was not compensated for this review

good plot structure with a nice twist at the end a short story that has encouraged me to look at purchasing more of his books

i really enjoyed these books the characters in them the authors did a great job building the chemistry between the characters but i felt like they were all to short more like novellas than individual novels i felt like someone hit the fast forward button on the remote and just glanced over parts of the actual story they also ended quickly i felt like the stories were unfinished

sean morrow was the outcast of the family the b st rd son of the patriarch of the family the one that never was wanted and the one that always wanted to escape leaving one family that he never felt accepted in for another this one a motorcycle club sean is finally ready to return home after five years abby was unsure of herself feeling unworthy expect for in the eyes of her best friend and only boy she had ever loved but that boy broke her heart when he walked away from her five years ago she s had to fight to prove that she isn t a failure and with sean returning that fight just got a bit harder in the final installment of the morrow brother s we get to know sean whose name had been dropped a few times here and there throughout both the prior books i wasn t on board with this particular installment and i can t really put my finger on why abby was a fierce little heroine that had her share of battles and the scars to prove she won i think for the first time in a long time i ended up liking the heroine a bit more than the hero sean was aggressive and an alpha but that persona just didn t fit with his more damaged side enough for me i felt like we got two different sean s and the two just never meshed into one in my opinion over all i still greatly enjoyed the series and the stories that jackie ashenden told the high point was definitely donovan s book but the series itself fell around a star read i look forward to seeing what other works this author might have in store for us in the future
yes i read it through it s not zane thankfully and not mcmurtry but a readable story historical accuracy is ok but i can t place my finger on why it just didn t click with me
this is a pretty darn good space opera there is much fighting and definitely a lot of intrigue suitable for all ages enjoy this romp on the wild side

so once again i was thoroughly disappointed sometimes i wonder if i should read any reviews at all but i can t help myself everyone has different taste but let me tell you why i gave this story such a poor rating i felt like there were pages missing or desperately required a prologue of some sort the story started out with jumping the shark and then as i kept reading i felt even more lost because it didn t explain how these two fell for one another nor was there a background established definitely no characterization whatsoever it certainly had potential and liked the premise of the plot but was not enough to satisfy the advent reader in me

i don t think i can continue reading this book i am only through i am struggling to read any more does it get better the story premise is good the writing not so much i have nothing against having the main characters pov as each chapter and in other novels i have enjoyed this style of writing however i this novel it seems i am not sure but maybe lacking or a bit forced the story so far is not well executed

addie logan survives an attack discovering she has been turned into the fulcrum it is her job to bring balance to two gorgeous demon hunters jett and locan now part of the trio they will fight the daemon threat while forming a loving relationship this box set includes books one through five in the demon lovers series unbalanced unbound unmasked unleashed and undaunted the demon lovers box set is a quick read it is a good collection to peruse when you want something light sensual and relaxing to read complimentary copy provided publisher via netgalley in exchange for an honest review

the storyline moved along like the year old lady that was the supposed murder she wrote tottering sleuths i had a hard time believing the abilities of our senior detective too much observation and not enough actual action for my taste

this is a good story it is too short to be a good book reasoner is a great writer but i think this one was probably written as a magazine story louis lamour may be the only one that could do that successfully

i quite enjoyed this story ms risk does an excellent job with the medical detail i particularly enjoyed the fact that ms risk deals with the weight issue mary beth was not your typical heroine and it was nice for a change both characters showed quite a bit of personal growth each facing their insecurities and overcoming them i ll defintely be reading more from this author
these two books are pretty good i enjoy reading books about seals and their exploits these have a little bit of sexual encounters along with a little mystery

whew there is a lot going on in supernatural freak if you like paranormal adventure mysteries you are in the right place supernatural freak drops you right in the middle of action and the main character has to fend off a werewolf attack within the first of the book and it doesn t stop afterwards that is action packed robyn seemed like she was getting attacked left and right throughout the story she is a tough cookie though that s for sure she would not give up i admired that about her i also loved her sense of humor it was perfect to break of up some of the more action packed scenes along with robyn we meet her eclectic group of friends i really liked them too especially william my favorite thing about supernatural freak was the variety of paranormal supernatural creatures it kind of reminded me of paranormalcy by kiersten white in that regard i love it when a book is not a pure vampire or witch book if the world can incorporate a bunch of different creatures and have them make sense in the story that is a lot better in my opinion and louisa klein did a great job of not only including a bunch of different creatures but also giving them all their own little role or place in the world those details really added to the story the writing style was a little off for me at times i wasn t the biggest fan of the first person it was kind of jarring for me and i found myself getting confused early on in the story once the mysterious tree handed kid came into the story i found myself getting more interested and the first person didn t throw me off as much and now this is a small point but i caught myself thinking it a bunch of times while reading there are a lot of really long paragraphs some multiple pages long that i would have liked to seen broken up a bit more it was kind of hard on my eyes to read one huge block of works on the page i think supernatural freak would appeal to both guys and girl readers because the romance is not a big element in this story at all there is a little bit of romance but this is a paranormal book not a paranormal romance disclaimer i got a copy of this book for free in exchange for my honest review i was not compensated for my review

ashley dawson is use to waking up to spirits but this certain spirit is different this spirit named sara manifests and wants ashley to visit a man named nathaniel marshall ashley is instantly drawn into the mystery that is surrounding this spirit and wants to help sara immediately she finds out that nathaniel was sara s husband and sara wants her to help nathaniel heal this is one hard job to do when nathaniel is not about to believe ashley s bizarre explanation nathaniel was devastated when his wife passed away and has never fully recovered now that a curvy vivacious woman has shown up on his doorstep saying that his dead wife has sent her to heal him nathaniel really thinks he has gone crazy but maybe what happened to his wife wasn t an accident and that is what sara is trying to say by bringing ashley into the picture the truth will come to light but at what price will nathaniel lose ashley too at the hands of someone hell bent on revenge the beginning is hauntingly good and continues its pace throughout whittier weaves characters from her previous book and continues the intense emotions all the way to the end i do have to say that the tidbit about her friend s boyfriend was predictable but i am thinking there might be another story coming out with those two e book was provided by author for an honest review

i know this is her first book and i commend her for the effort however i think she would be better off writing teen novels instead of adult romance i felt i was reading a story about an adolescent by an adolescent misty acted like a naive teenager instead of an almost year old woman the story has great potential and i would like to see it after the author matures in her writing enough to rework it but as it is i just cannot recommend it at the very least she needs a new editor how did so many grammatical errors make it through the editing process that in itself was distracting i m only glad it was a free kindle read i would hate to know i paid for it

i appreciated the level of reality in the book i could relate to the characters well from a negative stand point i felt the end was rushed maybe the last chapters could have been more detailed other than that i m glad i bought it

i like the story plot but there was too much dialogue of the lead female character thinking and assuming i never got the feeling that the men cared for her beyond sex i took a while for me to figure out she was a black woman the men were described to the t but i knew she had a lot of hair that was bushy or thick great description of the setting felt like i could actually visualize the forest seemed a bit rushed at the end i think the story should be revised but i did like the concept of the characters situation
this isn t a book it s more of a pamphlet and this isn t just moving for dummies it s moving for idiots

i have given every one of her books stars this time i was very disappointed unless you had read her other books you would have no clue who the characters were but even so i felt it hard to follow then it suddenly ended not a happy reader here while i knew it was a short story it was shorter than i wanted i since have read her next book just now ordered her latest though so i do like the author

the author has talent real talent the story was easy enough to follow that s about all the good things i can say about the book the over simplified political commentary backdrop views were distracting to a point where the storyline fell apart

the hero in this story was really funny he had a great sense of humor which is missing in so many novels like this one it s refreshing to read about attractive men who aren t angry and out of touch with their feelings and desires however the disappointment of this story was the love the passionate encounters between the hero and heroine were short dull unromantic and forgettable the thing that sticks out in my mind was a short lame liaison on a kitchen floor not the kitchen counter not the kitchen table but the kitchen floor blech

i really hope the writer didn t quit her day job to do this full time it was like a teenager armed with google set out and wrote a novel any potential this story had was decimated by immature characters and generic dialogue it was but i feel like i overpaid there really isn t enough time to get into everything but i will say that i think l p dover could be great in this genre someday the characters behaved and spoke like they were teens or barely in their twenties when they were supposed to be much older i found some of the plot unrealistic mainly because of this the story could could have done with a few more drafts and a better beta proofreader
it was certainly worth the price but not the best novel i gave read no real suspense to the plot it all pretty much leads up to the one erotic love scene at the end of the book
more like a few pages the premise was interesting but if you read the blurb you have literally read the entire thing don t waste your time

this a short story without an ending seems like a teaser for a full length novel that isn t published yet this kind of work should have been an add on to gods of guilt at the end with a possible publishing date to look forward to not a stand alone i feel like i just got duped out of

i received an e copy of this book from the publishers at netgalley in exchange for an honest review as is customary for me i scoured netgalley for new reads and stumbled across this little gem i loved the cracked and creepy cover as well as the seemingly horrific synopsis i had my fingers crossed a lucky rabbit s foot clutched in my hand and a wish on a star that i would find this book to be everything the appearance made it out to be natalie s story begins with her determination to leave the safety of her adopted family to search out and destroy her abusive father that has thrust himself back into her life she has the limp and the scars to prove that her father is a very dangerous man and to protect the people that she loves she knows she must draw him away from them and kill him once and for all naturally things don t go as planned her father has no desire to wait until she is safely out of town before he comes after her it is this little problem that causes her to have to come clean to her best friend and adopted sister about her father and his odd obsession with her her sister decides that natalie cannot do this alone and she will help her rid her life of the fiend who haunts her dreams that is all that i managed to get into the book i am a firm believer in always finishing what you begin i swore to myself that i would never start a book and not finish it especially not if it was only something pages that is such a short read i should have been able to finish it despite not liking it unfortunately after nearly two weeks of only being able to read a page of two at a time i finally had to resign myself to having to write my first dnf did not finish review it is disheartening that something i hoped would be so wonderful turned out to not be able to draw me in in the slightest the book s writing was a little off kilter in the beginning i had no idea who was talking since it was in first person narrative i had no pronouns such as he or she to go off i had to go back to the synopsis to figure out whether the protagonist was a female or male that was my first issue the next was in natalie as a character natalie as a character has a lot of baggage naturally she seemed to always be the wounded victim and that may be possibly why i couldn t finish the book i like my characters to have a few scars but be able to power through it and come out the other side perhaps if i kept reading natalie would have rallied but after making it through and still not being able to continue without gritting my teeth i had to throw in the towel would i be willing to try out another of chris little s books perhaps but not very likely review posted on

ok maybe its me but this book is getting on my nerves im trying to finish it but i can t seem to force myself to finish it the problem is this where is the development of j dog and kelis relationship its so unbelievable that it mess up the book for me plus i ve read this same senerio over and over that its not even worth my time because i already know the ending years ago i might have been impressed but after reading great books with development i have to give tnis a star because in the beginning it was ok but half way im irritated

i have read four of this authors books this one is and is quite similiar to the second book the first three books were quite good because they were a natural progression through this year old bounty hunter life however when this one was read i was disappointed to know that the plot was not unique mr thomas is a better than average writer i was a little disappointed to see that this principled young man of such a young age had to be engaged in a night of pleasure with a woman this side light did not add to the plot all in all books were above average this one is not

it s funny in spots and predictable all throughout it s glossy not real and tries too hard this character doesn t know what the real world is of course it s a puff piece although the author tries to be amusing her his whoever s homophobia and stupidity about transexuals and cross dressers is all too evident the cheap shot of dumping nambla into the mix is totally wrong and unacceptable and yet some of her characters are gay men for god s sake don t you know any better

there s a lot to love in mel comley s impeding justice it s a well told story with a great villain a strong supporting cast at the police station an awesome look at society gone bad in london and several thrilling plot twists unfortunately i had a tough time getting past the fact that i didn t like the main character lorne simpkins i know i was supposed to but there was just something missing such a well told story but not enough development of the lead as a human being it s odd because there were so many other great details in the book i would ve liked a few more on lorne instead i felt a lot was just thrown out there about her love life and sexism for instance and i was being asked to simply accept it show don t tell i mention this because i otherwise would ve rated this stars on a scale the second half of the book is especially fast moving and the ending is simply breath taking i d easily recommend this to anyone interested in police thriller stories

i haven t read any of this authors other novels but here is my review of this one it was a little grosser than i was expecting the book description didn t really let me know that i would be reading so much gore it is a setup for future novels i didn t like the gore so i won t read others probably by this author and there is no good ending to this book i read until the end only to find out the secret and i didn t get it disappointing if you like suspense and very descriptive gore type writing this is your book and series

a very difficult book to read because it is so confusing i think a glossary of words at the beginning of the book would have helped as there were some frequently used words and concepts that were very difficult to understand about the first of the book i felt lost and confused but kept reading thinking it would all click later and later much did start to make sense but by then i am not sure i really cared also the introduction of the characters was not well handled and names and people just thrown in and i had a hard time remembering who was who and no real image of them to pull upon in my mind i like the description of the book but the actual book was not at all what i expected i received this book free for a review but this review is truly how i feel about the book
what a very cute story it made me wish i was at the lodge i also enjoyed a happy ending

the storyline from the blurb had me hooked then i started reading it and just couldn t really follow i think the story needs to be a little more simple and to the point im sure a lot of time has been put into this book but its just to much to much that i couldn t enjoy the story sorry i was really looking forward to reading this great idea thou

this story was just ridiculous rajah and larkspur are completely out of place in this story they speak like modern people larkspur likes to call a certain part of rajah s body yummy frequently and they re both supposed to be virgins but exhibit an amazing grasp of the mechanics and techniques of sex it keeps the reader from getting involved in the story at all it s like reading an erotic story set in modern times that has somehow been gene spliced with a story about a dragon and his human mate and neither story benefits from the incongruity lark is also an annoying character she and her father were split up by pirates she has no idea where he is and she is kidnapped by a dragon she resists for about two minutes before deciding to spend the rest of her life with him i couldn t have much respect for somebody who didn t even care to find out how her father was or letting him know that she was okay and she s so demanding do me this way do me that way do me this way rajah was talking about spending the next three hundred years with her i give him a week and a half before he drops her back into the ocean completely fed up with her

ok here goes nothing on my review of this book it captured me on the first page and kept me going all the way to the end the ups and downs to this book made me feel like i was on a roller coaster geez martin and reese great main characters along with cecelia but what had me captured at the beginning of the book had me really confused at the end of the book no epilogue what is up with that the book to me has a cliffhanger in it and i am thinking like where is the rest of the book the way the ending was didn t satisfied me at all it just kept me hanging there was no closure at least in my opinion in this book in my opinion someone really needs to finish this book write the rest of the book already my review is at stars and a note to the author please finish this book get the book if it is on the free side don t waste your money if it isn t

i waited awhile for this book because i love the first two books but after i started reading it i became disappointed with all the editing errors lots of mispelled words missing words mixed up names it made it extremely hard to follow the storyline because i stumbled over errors i would have rated it lower but the story is good but the editing sucked

friends with benefits is a sweet different m eacute nage story that i m sure will a ease those looking for lots of sex along with their story any fans of the genre will enjoy the story of angela tyler and connor angela and tyler have been together for many years they have a great marriage and are both willing to indulge in the others fantasies to spice things up a bit little does angela know that tyler has something up his sleeve hopefully it s something she ll enjoy connor and tyler have known one another since college they re actually best friends and share better than the average besties when tyler goes to connor for a favor connor is a bit reluctant once he gets a taste of what s to come he can t seem to get enough but will it all be alright with tyler or will their friendship be forever ruined i enjoyed the story but was honestly pissed and tyler and the way he went about certain things by the end of the story i went from dislike to like with him but not love connor on the other hand had me at hello a good first experience for me with this author i look forward to what she ll release in the future
it is a good thing this was cheap it is a prelude to innocence and just gives you a short idea of the main character in innocence it is not necessary to read this before you read innocence

soul hunger is a book that suffers from a well known ailment first book syndrome the author clearly has a world that she wants to develop but unfortunately tries to do so all in the first chapter paragraph after paragraph of expository background the cast of characters is stereotyping we have the tough scary leader his straight talking right hand man the bookish historian and the lover that no one ever rejects and a couple of less developed others i guess in case the series needs expanding now i know what i m reading when i m looking at books like this as the blurb says mehen must protect mortals from the undead has never struggled with the task until he saves a woman from three undead and finds himself in need of saving i know i m not passing through the frosty upper echelons of high literature as a result my expectations were not that high overall it s not a bad story it s just not a good story the plot is roughly handled with some chapters reading as filler between random and pointless sex scenes the main female character is so bland she was almost irrelevant there are also the odd turns of phrase that an editor should have caught she had never seen a better looking man in person in her entire life that really is just clunky writing and then there s she regarded him with a small amount of fear lurking in her eyes an amount of something cannot lurk fear can lurk in her eyes sure but an amount the english language just doesn t work that way this is what a decent editor should have picked up on and polished with the author also a little more attention to word choice is necessary i m sure just being here with you will cause mehen to wale on me wale is a horizontal wooden strip for a boat according to the dictionary the right homophone is wail spelt just like the sound this isn t being picky if you re going to publish then you need to do it right add to that the clunky plot development and inability to handle the many characters in the story and you have a book that is a bit of a mess i imagine with practice and an editor who is more attentive this writer could improve overall it s readable and as such is worth it s price

dont waste your dollar this book is pretty much a repeat of the previous two love this series but feel this was a distraction to say the least the only good part imo is the end which if anything shows the potential for a new series centered around lief

there is a lot to love about this fast romp if you love nerd heros and heroines this is the book for you the leads meet on line in a video game and then plan to meet at a fantasy gaming convention in person the hero has a career he can t reveal and the heroine is coming off a bad break up with a fellow member of her game guild these parts of their characters were well developed the hero suffers from what i call beauty burden he is very good looking and he tends to attract much more conventional women than the type he likes which are smart feisty cute nerdy women he liked to let his nerd flag fly and loves to dress up in costume for cos costume play which is a common nerd fun at conventions this makes him a wonderful and interesting hero the writing here is good although jumpy in points of view and focus in places the scope of the book is very narrow we get very little secondary characters though i would like trevor a co worker of the hero to get his own story we also know very little about the characters backstories and families this was a fun witty book and with real sexy times and i look forward to more books by this writer this book was given to me for my honest review
i like the story line but to much sex for i was very disappointed because of that the constant sex took away from the story for me sorry

this is the most boring book i have ever attempted to read i felt zero connection between the hero and the heroine the idea of the story was a good one an ex boyfriend the love of her life is attending the same wedding they reconnect and she hopes something will happen however he was the one that broke up with her and left her broken hearted and trying to get over him he speaks to her and she is ready to give it all another chance really don t you think you would have wanted to know why he broke things off in the first place and what he has on his mind in the second then his family seems to think she broke his heart so obviously he lied to them still not a problem for her there was just zero chemistry between these two plus it was so boring we went to work with her came home changed clothes watched tv etc and one day went into the next there was never anything to get excited about i really didn t care for any of the characters i had a problem too with her never asking him just what the heck he had on his mind at i thought i really didn t care what happened to these two and i was bored enough to almost fall asleep so i gave up don t waste your time i wish i hadn t wasted as much as i did

miranda and wade get a call from one of wade s former trainees to consult on a high profile murder in las vegas after exhausting the obvious leads in the case miranda can t let go of the feeling that she has missed something her determination pays off in the end but not in the way she imagines her can do attitude will not allow her to give up until the case is solved there seemed to not be the same level of suspense as in previous miranda and parker mysteries at least not to me it was fast moving and interesting though

i really like this author i loved the mitchell series i think i compare her other books to that and its not fair to her i really just could not relate to the characters so much back and forth kat was just annoying

i consider this more a short story rather than a novel and a good thing too because i did not enjoy reading it it has a cute premise however this book is a little dated and has no basis in reality in terms of what it s like to live in new york among the rich people don t send taxi s to pick a person up they send a car service if you re hurting for money you don t live on park avenue and if you were a debutante you generally don t need to work it would have been more interesting if there was more back story to why a former deb was now so poor she needed extra work to buy a kitten i liked the premise a lot but overall it was just a ridiculously written story with juvenile dialogue and absurd circumstances
all the books diane capri wrote are very good but this one completely bottom of my list i will still read her books but not these series

i would consider this a novella short that would be leading into a series first time reading this author definitely a romance story and not anyway eroticathe story line was interesting since it was so short if kind of felt rushed i was confused at first because based on the cover i was thinking it was a historical romance so after the little entrance blurb of the first chapter i was a little weirded out that it switched to present day i also prefer the men in my novels to be a bit more manly he seemed like kind of a pusscake until after she had bitten him and even them seemed to feel guilty for being manly

this is not a series of what i would call kick ass heroines and hot heroes the stories were too bland and wordy i skimmed a lot just not my kind of stories the title was very misleading you really have to watch out on the bundles

i have enjoyed reading full length novels by julianne maclean and really expected this novella to be a pleasurable read not so much the writing seemed unusually clunky and the novella read like cliff notes to a book the author used a style that i detest in romance novels she had the characters mentally recite the story line like a year old to clue the reader in to what was happening rather than allowing the actions of the character to reveal the story to the reader if this were my first exposure to ms macleans writing it is unlikely i would ever read one of her full length novels

release begins with ryann and jeremy first seeing each other when ryann has car trouble in the rain on her way an art show her whole world is fixing to change by just glancing at jeremy through a window once she finally arrives at the art gallery she sees jeremy again this time though the attraction is undeniable and jeremy is bound and determined to have her these two continue to dance around it because ryann is scared but jeremy is very relentless and doesn t give up on her but other problems arise that try to keep them apart jeremy and ryann had a sweet passionate relationship it was a very nice romance and it made the book enjoyable i really did like release the writing was good and i enjoyed all of the characters most of the side characters i hope to see get their own story like ryann s best friend for instance the only thing that bothered me was the first half of the book seemed a little bit forced like it just didn t flow very well and i was sometimes bored with it but then the rest of the book was very interesting and very enjoyable i am actually looking forward to more in this series as well

novellas are difficult for most authors at best but when they are this short they are nearly impossible no time to develop any characters plot tension or anything else so you end up with a predictable bedtime story

these days a lot of material is being called poetry even though it doesn t rhyme or have a rhythm unfortunately this book falls into that category if it was great prose perhaps that would be redeeming but it isn t i was disappointed in its lack of depth but maybe i should have read the title traveling light no real food for thought here

i agree with the reviewer who said this was just too thin ray is a werewolf cop who hates the assumptions that people make about weres and there he is refusing a relationship with his mate because he is a fairy and you know what they all say about fairies it got marked down big time for me because the ending was so weak basically a retelling of the entire story again with a slightly different pov that s just cheap and lazy writing i skimmed the last which means i didn t really read it to get a real stars i have to read it from cover to cover and this one i didn t but it gets rather than stars because it is well written and because ray is suitably intense i readplay it again charliefrom the same author first and thought it too wasn t flawless it was a better book on the same theme though with no supernatural element
i have not read the book i read the description and there were so many typos in just that one paragraph that i passed on the book at least proof the book description before it is posted
short but then it s supposed to be i haven t read the corresponding saga i started to but it seemed much too much like the last series i read by him and i got turned off

sweet novella made to order jeff finds himself breaking under the unexpected yolk of parenthood his best friend perished in a house fire and asked him to raise their jeff was the sperm donor year old boy and month old baby girl donny shows up in response to jeff s ad for a nanny the rest is cookie cutter stuff although nicely done complete with a psycho ex boyfriend who threatens to wreck everything
i was expecting something way better i will definitely be looking for something way better this book went on for far too long
when you know how the author can write this is not his best work i would probalbly skip this one and go straight to mech one

i m not really sure where this book is going maybe it would make sense if i read the second part but the first book left me completely uninterested besides that there were numerous grammatical errors and poor editing

i found it very hard to finish this book it didn t hold my attention i read the synopsis of the story and was interested because i had read a series by maya banks called the colter s series which i enjoyed very much but this was no maya banks the dialogue between the characters seemed forced and there was no chemistry i struggled to finish this book so i will not recommend it to others
this book was a huge disappointment to me bianca and her friends were as dumb as a box of rocks then she ends up with the obsessed stalker really

i am a big fan of vampire romance novels and was given a complimentary copy of this to review overall i felt the story was too short and didn t give any background information on the characters we are immediately thrust into the story near the culmination of the characters relationship since i didn t feel that i knew the characters at all i didn t really care what happened to them there should have been more information included on each characters background characters also just appeared with no information on them at all the author also gives us no real understanding of his vampire world and what the vampires capabilities and limitations are overall i would not recommend this book

while i did enjoy reading parts of these books they basically all have the same story dominating males helpless females and special needs children absolutely no disrespect meant to the latter i read all the books but got very bored with the way these so called alpha males behaved no way would i ever find that kind of man sexy jmo

i ve heard this author being compared to laurann dohner but i hate to say that this book lacks a plot storyline i loved the sex scenes but since the story lacked a plot it just became redundant and boring i love sex scenes but without a plot it s like watching bad porn the author could have discussed a nefarious infiltration into the red feather organization that sold slaves women to their enemy or better yet set the stage for political turmoil among the troops old traditions vs new traditions or even espionage i hope this writer improves especially if she s read anne rice s claiming sleeping beauty
i enjoyed this book the pace keep the action moving and the plot kept me interested i appreciated the way that it treated the mid eastern characters with respect

this unrealistic and unbelievable story had me shaking my head when it was thankfully over i was expecting an agatha christie mystery in a short story format there is no mystery just a husband and a wife who have grown apart mr parker pyne is consulted and prescribes a course of action i won t spoil it by going into details but if you are looking for an ac story with substance pass this one up

okay weird as hell is all i can say it seemed to be about a guy going to prison a girl who waited for him but had to face some mess and he saved her from it when he got home i think that the author did attempt to tell a story but i did not get much from it super excited this one is now off the kindle

i am a sucker for any apocalyptic story this book entertained me but there were a number of frustrations the author is not a bad storyteller nevertheless the book has shortcomings which include grammer punctuation spelling and continuity the story shifts from being told in the first person to third person there are very few quotation marks to indicate dialogue several words like shortcomings are short comings one character in the book is sally in the beginning mary in the middle and sally again in the latter part of the story in anticipation of some future calamity the two main characters assemble a utopian survival village they do so with a lot of money and little or no obstacles they acquire equipment and skilled folks needed should there be a collapse of society as we know it if only it were that simple and i would like a nickel for every piece of pie mentioned in the book i would encourage the author to keep at it but get someone to edit his work
this book or sample of a book lost my attention within the first few pages as a mid twenties woman i usually enjoy a good young adult book but this wasn t good maybe younger teens would like it
trick or treat or murder was a fast festive read for halloween i thought rachel was a great character she kept me very entertained give this mystery a try

i read the reviews so i knew what to expect but i love mary calmes she s written some of my all time favorites so i went ahead and bought it anyway it has themes she often writes about in fact her books much as i love them are starting to blur there is always the too perfect narrator who underestimates his impact on those around him and the more aggressive love interest who needs some polishing i love these themes but here everything was too rushed and too odd it would have worked just as well or better without the supernatural element which felt grafted on and silly i liked julian quieter longing for connection refusing to sleep around but ryan felt like a pastiche just personality traits squished together without becoming a whole i rate it stars rounded up to because i finished it

i didn t like the first in this series but i read the second to see what would happen i shouldn t have bothered this one is more gruesome and perverse than the first i didn t like any of the characters and the ending still left everything hanging i guess tomerlin is working on the third one now but i don t plan to read it the only character i slightly liked was killed off in book and i just don t care what happens to anyone the writing has merit but i ve never read a book so dark and seedy it s worse than any horror film there were only a few minor errors sync was used but it didn t come into our vocabulary until the s sent was used for scent for for far and kate clutched of the larger crates still the writing was good it was the content that i object to i know i ll get some no helpful votes for this review like i did one the first one and it hurt my score as a reviewer but i feel i must be honest i will not lie about how i feel about a book
this book was mildly entertaining i enjoy renovating and decorating and i liked the details in this book so i would probably read the sequel
i never really liked the hero and there never really was a moment of resolution it was an interesting plot with potential but it never really delivered
i usually like what helen cooper writes but not this time would have appreciated more character development very disappointed in this one so not worth it

i purchased the paperback version really good book it has some pictures of the recipes which adds color to the book great recipes that meet all the required meals all day long list price really exciting most books on a diet of such size and usually without pictures cost a lot more than really important to me that the writer chose to write in big letters it really helps me to read the recipes when i prepare food in the kitchen

the plot of this book is terrific a warlock opens a little b lack book and is cursed he meets a witch librarian that specializes in curses the warlock has alot of personality as a human and as a cat a good solid read

revived from the past enter into the future how would it be well not like this flat slow tracked incoherent narrative cheap yes but also cheap and unoriginal read something else anything would be better use your dollar to buy a coffee and to the author get an editor
i enjoyed this short story the backstory was worked in very nicely and i liked that mary was obviously a tough woman

there are two things i m tired of in zombie fiction is trying to give the undead a personality want an undead with a personality write about vampires or mummies i like my zombies slow stupid and numerous number is the nihilistic no hope story there are far too many of these around too i like to see human intelligence win out over the zombies this story might be good for some but i found it predictable and in some cases dull

daniella s husband william a surgeon has joined the union army and left the family in independence missouri after coming home on leave he sends a letter announcing to daniella that he wants a divorce he has a mistress and she s expecting a child some time later he comes home intent upon taking their sons to baltimore to live with him and his mistress really this is the story of the personal battle between them the civil war is the backdrop but not terribly important to the story well written and engaging but not terribly outstanding that said i would read this author again
this was a very strange yet entertaining read it had me laughing at one point and almost in tears the next i really couldn t understand the drama with tacaria or ash waiting for part two recommended
